newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia's Sentra to produce synthetic rubber.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia's Sentra to produce synthetic rubber.

text.p: Indonesia's PT Sentra Sintetikajaya, a unit of the Gadjah Tunggal Group, said on Tuesday it has started construction of the country's first synthetic rubber plant.

The $100 million plant, to be located in West Java and scheduled for completion in early 1998, will have an initial annual production capacity of 60,000 tonnes of styrene butadiene rubber (SBR) to be increased later to 150,000 tonnes, Gadjah Tunggal said in a statement.

SBR is a key raw material needed in the production of tyres. The statement said 70 percent of the synthetic rubber produced will be sold to the country's largest tyre firm PT Gadjah Tunggal, another member of the Gadjah Tunggal Group.
The remaining 30 percent will be sold to other local firms and exported to regional markets, it said.

The Gadjah Tunggal Group is one of Indonesia's largest conglomerates, consisting of more than 70 companies with interests ranging from petrochemicals, tyre manufacturing and banking to property and trading.
